@graph.name: Greek Meatballs - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Greek Meatballs are a quick & easy main dish or appetizer ready in 20 minutes! Serve them with tzatziki, in a pita, or over a Greek salad!

@graph.name: What are Greek meatballs made of?

acceptedAnswer.text: Check out the ingredients list in the recipe card to find out.

Yes! If you are feeding a crowd you can easily double this recipe and make 60 meatballs. Or if you want to make a double batch and freeze some for later. This recipe, using 1 lb. of ground beef, makes 30 meatballs 1 TBS in size.

@graph.name: Greek Meatballs Recipe
@graph.description: These Greek Meatballs are a quick & easy, flavorful main dish or appetizer ready in 20 minutes! Serve them with tzatziki, wrapped in a pita, or over a Greek salad!

video.name: Greek Meatballs Recipe
video.description: These Greek Meatballs are a quick & easy, flavorful main dish or appetizer ready in 20 minutes! Serve them with tzatziki, wrapped in a pita, or over a Greek salad!

recipeIngredient: ½ cup breadcrumbs (or quick cooking oatmeal)
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper
Optional: ¼ cup finely diced fresh parsley or dill

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl combine ground beef, egg, milk and lemon juice.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl combine ground beef, egg, milk and lemon juice.

itemListElement.text: Add breadcrumbs, oregano, coriander, cumin, sea salt, pepper, garlic and onion and stir until evenly distributed.
itemListElement.name: Add breadcrumbs, oregano, coriander, cumin, sea salt, pepper, garlic and onion and stir until evenly distributed.

itemListElement.text: Use a 1 TBS measuring spoon to portion out heaping tablespoon portions of the meatball mixture. Roll them into balls and place them on a prepared baking sheet (if baking).
itemListElement.name: Use a 1 TBS measuring spoon to portion out heaping tablespoon portions of the meatball mixture. Roll them into balls and place them on a prepared baking sheet (if baking).

itemListElement.text: Add 1-2 TBS olive oil to a nonstick fry pan or cast-iron skillet and turn heat to medium.
itemListElement.name: Add 1-2 TBS olive oil to a nonstick fry pan or cast-iron skillet and turn heat to medium.

itemListElement.text: Add half of the meatballs and cover.
itemListElement.name: Add half of the meatballs and cover.

itemListElement.text: Cook, covered, on one side for 4-5 minutes or until they are golden-brown.
itemListElement.name: Cook, covered, on one side for 4-5 minutes or until they are golden-brown.

itemListElement.text: Remove lid and flip the meatballs. Cook for another 4-5 minutes until meatballs are golden brown and the internal temperature is 160 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Remove lid and flip the meatballs. Cook for another 4-5 minutes until meatballs are golden brown and the internal temperature is 160 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spread 1 TBS olive oil on a large baking sheet. Or spray the baking sheet with olive oil spray. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spread 1 TBS olive oil on a large baking sheet. Or spray the baking sheet with olive oil spray. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Place meatballs on the greased baking sheet evenly spread out.
itemListElement.name: Place meatballs on the greased baking sheet evenly spread out.

itemListElement.text: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Meatballs should reach an internal temperature of 160 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Meatballs should reach an internal temperature of 160 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: To serve: serve warm dipped in tzatziki sauce, stuffed in a pita, over a salad, with a side of roasted veggies, etc.
itemListElement.name: To serve: serve warm dipped in tzatziki sauce, stuffed in a pita, over a salad, with a side of roasted veggies, etc.
